text.beginner: You follow Captain Beatty and the other firemen up the sidewalk.
text.intermediate: You follow Captain Beatty and your fellow firemen, Stoneman, and Black up the sidewalk.
text.advanced: You follow Captain Beatty and your fellow firemen, Stoneman, and Black up the sidewalk.

text.beginner: They burst inside and grab a woman who does not try to escape.
text.intermediate: They crash through the front door and grab at a woman, who made no move to escape.
text.advanced: They crash through the front door and grab at a woman, who made no move to escape.

text.beginner: You still smell kerosene on your uniform.
text.intermediate: You can still smell the strong scent of kerosene on your uniform.
text.advanced: You can still smell the strong scent of kerosene on your uniform.

text.beginner: She sways, staring at the wall like she has been hurt.
text.intermediate: She is standing, weaving from side to side, her eyes fixed upon a nothingness in the wall as if they had struck her a terrible blow upon the head.
text.advanced: She is standing, weaving from side to side, her eyes fixed upon a nothingness in the wall as if they had struck her a terrible blow upon the head.

text.beginner: Her mouth moves as if she is trying to remember something.
text.intermediate: Her tongue was moving in her mouth, and her eyes seemed to be trying to remember something, and then they remembered and her tongue moves again.
text.advanced: Her tongue was moving in her mouth, and her eyes seemed to be trying to remember something, and then they remembered and her tongue moves again.

text.beginner: She quietly recites an old saying about courage and light.
text.intermediate: 'Play the man, Master Ridley; we shall this day light such a candle, by God's grace, in England, as I trust shall never be put out.'
text.advanced: 'Play the man, Master Ridley; we shall this day light such a candle, by God's grace, in England, as I trust shall never be put out.'

text.beginner: That's enough. Where are the books?
text.intermediate: Enough of that! Where are they?
text.advanced: Enough of that! Where are they?

text.beginner: Beatty hits her and asks again.
text.intermediate: Beatty slaps the woman's face, repeating the question.
text.advanced: Beatty slaps the woman's face, repeating the question.

text.beginner: She tells them they already know.
text.intermediate: You know where they are, or you wouldn't be here
text.advanced: You know where they are, or you wouldn't be here

text.beginner: The men begin tearing the house apart.
text.intermediate: Beatty, Stoneman, and Black swing their silver hatchets at doors that were unlocked
text.advanced: Beatty, Stoneman, and Black swing their silver hatchets at doors that were unlocked

text.beginner: Books rain down as you climb the stairs.
text.intermediate: A fountain of books fall upon you as you climb the sheer stairwell, but as you continue on
text.advanced: A fountain of books fall upon you as you climb the sheer stairwell, but as you continue on

text.beginner: One book lands in front of you.
text.intermediate: A book alights like a bird with its wings fluttering, landing in front of you
text.advanced: A book alights like a bird with its wings fluttering, landing in front of you

text.beginner: A line from the book catches your attention.
text.intermediate: Time has fallen asleep in the afternoon sunshine-
text.advanced: Time has fallen asleep in the afternoon sunshine-

text.intermediate: Your coworkers are above you, hurling shovelfuls of magazines into the dusty air.
text.advanced: Your coworkers are above you, hurling shovelfuls of magazines into the dusty air.
